com.flemil.ui.component
Class Panel

java.lang.Object
  com.flemil.ui.component.Panel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Item, Scrollable
public class Panel
extends java.lang.Object
implements Scrollable

Class that represents a collections of items that are treated as a group within the display if the application. A Panel can have a number of propereties that can be set by calling its methods. Such properties include things such the layout of the items within the Panel and whether the Panel should allow its contents to be scrolled horizontally or not. Panels can contain any collection of any items including other Panels, Lists and other basic Items

Author:
Solomon Kariri

isFocusible

public boolean isFocusible()
Description copied from interface: Item
Checks whether this Item can be set as the currently focused Item. This means that this Item should be able to adjust its behavior or look and feel in response to calls to its focusGained() or focusLost() methods

setPaintBorder

public void setPaintBorder(boolean paintBorder)
Description copied from interface: Item
Used to specify whether this Item should paint its border or not. If set true the Item will paint its border and not otherwise. All borders are painted one pixel wide and might be rounded at the edges depending on the Style settings of the application

Specified by:
setPaintBorder in interface Item
Parameters:
paintBorder - sets whether this Item should paint its border.

getItemsCount

public int getItemsCount()
Retuens the count of Items that has been added to this Panel. A Panel or List added to this Panel will be counted as s single Item. Items that contains a collection of other elements are also treated as such where the Item is counted as a single Item by its containing parent Item

Returns:
the number of Items that have been added to this Panel

setFocusAllOnFocus

public void setFocusAllOnFocus(boolean focus)
Sets whether this Panel should have all of its contained Items gain focus when it receives focus. This is handly when using Pnales with a collection of elements as List components where all the Items within the Panel will be required to gain focus

Parameters:
focus - true to focus on all Items on focus and false otherwise

pointerDraggedEventReturned

public void pointerDraggedEventReturned(int x,
                                        int y)
Description copied from interface: Item
Invoked by a child of this Item if it cannot handle a pointerDragged event passed to it. The parent then deals with the event if it can or propagates it to its parent if any if it cannot handle it. The coordinates are relative to the whole display area of the application and not this Item. To know whether the coordinate falls within its displayRect it can call the Rectangle.contains() method with the coordinates as the parameters.

Specified by:
pointerDraggedEventReturned in interface Item
Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the pointer
y - the y coordinate of the pointer
See Also:
Item.getDisplayRect()

repaint

public void repaint(Rectangle clip)
Description copied from interface: Item
Repaints the given region of this Item. Mostly all calls to this method will result in the propagation of the call to the parent of this Item until the bottom most Item is reached so that all Items whose displayRectanges are intersected by the repainted rectangles repaints the intersects as well

Specified by:
repaint in interface Item
Parameters:
clip - the clip region that is to be repainted

paint

public void paint(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics g,
                  Rectangle clip)
Description copied from interface: Item
Paints the region of this Item specified by the clip. The Item makes calculations to reduce as much as possible the area that is repainted for the Item. If the clip does not intersect in any way with this Items displayRectangle, then the Item is not painted at all.

Specified by:
paint in interface Item
Parameters:
g - the graphics on which the painting is to be done
clip - the region of the graphics that requires update or that is to be painted on by this Item

setAlignment

public void setAlignment(int alignment)
Sets the alignment to be used by this Panel to layout its Items. The value of this parameter is a binary or (|) operation on the values CENTER_VERTICAL_ALIGN ,CENTER_HORIZONTAL_ALIGN, LEFT_HORIZONTAL_ALIGN,RIGHT_HORIZONTAL_ALIGN, SPAN_FULL_WIDTH The resultant layout is quite straightforward from the names of the constants. for example passing the value CENTER_HORIZONTAL_ALIGN|CENTER_VERTICAL_ALIGN centers the contents of this Panel both vertically and horizontally. The values that determine the horizontal layout should be displayed only once for example its not recommended to use a value such as CENTER_HORIZONTAL_ALIGN|LEFT_HORIZONTAL_ALIGN will results in unpredictable results. Only one of the directives will be taken into consideration

Parameters:
alignment - the alignmen to be used to display items in this Panel.

scrollRectToVisible

public void scrollRectToVisible(Rectangle rect,
                                int scrollDirection)
Description copied from interface: Scrollable
Scrolls the given Rectangle such that its visible or falls within this items displayRect. This method makes sure that the top of the passed in rectangle is visible even though the bottom might not be visible if the passed in rect has a longer height than this Scrollble's displayRect. The remainder can/should be made possible via scrolling.

Specified by:
scrollRectToVisible in interface Scrollable
Parameters:
rect - the Rectangle to be made visible
scrollDirection - the direction in which to scroll. This value can be either Scrollable.DIRECTION_Y for Y scrolling only, Scrollable.DIRECTION_X for X scrolling only or Scrollable.DIRECTION_Y|Scrollable.DIRECTION_X for both Y and X scrolling
